channel.title: elroyjetson tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from elroyjetson.

item.description: @BryanBanksPhD https://t.co/xletW5Ts1F
@driscollis Google Colab
@davewiner Mastodon works well it just lacks a critical mass of users.

@bryanrieger @Twitter I have been using Mastodon for a while now. Other than suffering from a lack of momentum, it is as good as if not better than Twitter feature-wise and, presumably, more robust since it is distributed. You can run your own instance or join one that belongs to someone else.
Brand new hardware with a brand new OS! https://t.co/uLYiwSdz9L
@brad_frost Everyone needs a hobby. https://t.co/Vu2vHvUgTU
Canonical IPO in 2023...hmm, interesting. https://t.co/TaONMXtU0W

Good article by @ByJoshG on @CNET about why you probably just need a Chromebook. He only just barely mentions the most important Chromebook feature which is security. Power users can always add a Linux container to run Linux apps from too. https://t.co/Eun2ZhkuxG

I wrote about Dubai's Museum of the Future @MOTF back in 2018 when it was still being built https://t.co/sJ6fuNNNBb . Now that it is open @Casey has release a video about the museum in his classic storytelling vlog fashion. Very well done. https://t.co/iobxJBc1eG
I put up a post about the marvel of modern computing! https://t.co/k76lGVKjAo
@AaronGustafson I moved it out and into my iCloud account. No problem. I will probably not keep it there in the long run, but it got it out for now.
@davewiner I have looked for this type of app and it is a total unicorn. Everyone wants you trapped in their box. Maybe a good next project for you ðŸ˜‰!

@davewiner Proprietary and a Chinese based company which has been a target by the US government so it may be banned at any time. Outside of that it is the best solution I know of that matches all of your criteria.
@davewiner I hate to say it but...WeChat? https://t.co/SPxhBJzEwM

I would love to see someone detail why snaps are better than flatpaks or why flatpak is better than snaps. Maybe it comes down to that snaps update automatically and flatpak doesn't?
@BrodieOnLinux published a video (https://t.co/5WzZskEigl) that discusses this. He points to a more detailed explanation of all the hate about Snaps by @popey on reddit (https://t.co/XaoSO2mTE9). In the end I am still partial to Snaps and have seen nothing to change my mind.
@kevinmarks And dusting off Mastodon... https://t.co/gf8503pKf8

I find it frustrating that tech reviewers insist on taking a $400 ChromeBook, decide that while you can code on it, it is too painful. And then proceed to compare it to a $1500 (or greater) MacOS or Windows laptop. Get the right ChromeBook and it is easily a daily driver.
@mattbirchler I try and use the stock apps unless I have a good reason to do otherwise. So Terminal app
It would be nice if more apps on the iPad allowed me to make annotations with the pen. Especially the Apple Book apps.

Chromebooks are used in schools and loaned out at public libraries not because they are better than the alternatives but because they provide the right balance of fleet management, security, and good enough. https://t.co/Y2CEorwglp
